intro: Avena pubescens var. glabra, commonly known as the smooth oat, is a perennial grass species characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. It produces small, spikelet-based flowers that are typically green to brown in color, which develop into oval, hard-seeded fruits. The plant is native to temperate regions of the northern hemisphere and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Its dense growth habit makes it a valuable species for erosion control and wildlife habitat. Avena pubescens var. glabra is also sometimes cultivated as a forage crop due to its nutritional value for livestock.
